intro: Verbesina ancashensis, commonly known as the Andean beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Verbesina ancashensis is adapted to the harsh conditions of the Andean environment, showing resilience to cold and strong winds.
